description: I need an app like this all along. Thank You for creating it!
I have a lot of hope for this app. It is still being refined ... but the idea is superb. I have been waiting for one like this on linux ...
Beautiful and simple design with a lot of useful features. If it supports some kind of sync, this would be perfect!
summary: One of the best todo apps on linux!

description: After of long time, it continue update thanks to Jonsoa....
It has the necessary features to help you organize project tasks and not work related but also anything thanks to the tagging system. The subtasking works great and the scheduling comes handy

Pros:

-easy to use
-very customizable 
-great for organizing college courses
	-I use a tag "college" with 3 sub-tags, "homework", "study", "exams." My courses are a task with no start or due date, and the assignments, exams, etc are added as sub-tasks with their respective tags and start/due dates.

Cons:

-none 

Wishes:

-I hope in the future they can implement a way to show a percentage next to a parent task based on the number of sub-tasks completed, similar to OpenTasks on android.
I have been looking for this type of tool for a long time. Thanks to all of developers.
No distracting bells and whistles, i like it
i use it all the time to set goals
Keep up the good work
summary: Nice App to organize one's goals

description: Simple and well designed to-do app.

After first installing it, the app worked not with problems (crashing when clicking in subtasks, opening in a disordered multiple windows way, etc). But after few days essentially stopped working at all, it does not lunch. It is a real pitty as I invested some time in scheduling my task, and I really like the philosophy behind it. I really wanted to like this app.
summary: Not working in Fedora 34 Gnome40 Wayland

description:
GTG is the most useful tool of the Gnome Software Suite. Sadly sinc a couple of releases it is really buggy and crashes, especially when plugins activated or with checked sub-tasks or just a lot of tags. 

It would be really great to have a calendar view or some sort of thing to keep track in a more visual way. Also it would be really helpfull if there would be an option to set a specific hours for tasks.
summary: Generally really great to manage a lot of tasks

description: Simple way to organize my tasks.
I often find with task managers I might hit a roadblock on a task. In many cases a seemingly small task turns into a larger project. I appreciate this apps handling of that occurrence.
Not Opening At all in Fedora 35
summary: Not Opening At all in Fedora 35

description:
After installation in ubuntu 21.10, it opened and after that it neverd opened. tried uninstall and reinstall. 
Not working at all.
only opens when I do flatpak run org.gnome.GTG . Fix please.

No icon in launcher. I tried it in the terminal by:
 getting-things-gnome.gtg 

And here is the output:

 Failed to register: GDBus.Error:org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.AccessDenied: Connection ":1.3905" is not allowed to own the service "org.gnome.GTG" due to AppArmor policy
Not sure why others are having an issue with opening the app. Mine installed without issue and opens fine on Fedora 35. I used the flathub flatpak version.
nice touch, love it!
Assume it will work on later versions. Early days, but like what I've seen.

I cannot use spaces in some areas of the program. Kind of want deb package as well, huge disappoint that I can't get that. Not that I believe in any of this other stuff but any S.M.A.R.T or S.W.O.T. stuff that might be added? in nautilus space will up a "picture" viewer and you can continue to use arrow keys... going to add that? mouse operations are great but don't forget to add those keyboard stuff

Really neat and extremely powerful once you figure it out, the only problem is that the help option in the menu in the top right corner just opens a blank window, almost certainly a bug, possibly an artifact specific to flatpak as I see alot of those lol. Keep up the good work
summary: Nice app but the documentation is blank..

description:
I think it needs to improve a lot. 
One of the things I'd add is to set the font styles from the beggining, I constantly find myself typing and the text suddently changes its font weight and size, it makes it harder to write the task.
summary: Its okay but its not great

description: will this app start receiving security updates?
summary: One of the best todo apps ive used so far

description: Diese Leute wissen, was für eine gute TODO-App nötig ist, denn sie sind teilweise schon seit Jahren mit dem Prinzip "Getting Things Done" unterwegs. Sie haben die brachliegende App erneuert und das Ergebnis macht Freude. Ich bin auf kommende Features gespannt.
Definitivamente una de las cosas que no pueden faltar en tu entorno de trabajo. Simplemente irreemplazable

Da error en debian 12
**Context:** Activation

```python-traceback
None```

**Software versions:**
* Getting Things GNOME! 0.6.0
* CPython 3.11.2 (main, Mar 13 2023, 12:18:29) [GCC 12.2.0]
* GTK 3.24.38, GLib 2.74.4
* PyGLib 3.42.2, PyGObject 3.42.2

L'application semble excellente dans son fonctionnement, agile, simple et puissante à la fois. Mais bon sang, des erreurs apparaissent tous les 5 clics ! La synchronisation calDav ne semble pas stable (saute après la fermeture).
summary: Beaucoup de potentiel, mais trop bugguée

description: Планировщик задач должен помогать эффективно распределять время, а тут надо сначала запланировать полдня на чтение мануалов и танцы с бубном, чтобы прикрутить синхронизацию. "0 с лишним лет прошло, а нихрена с моего прошлого раза когда я ставил линух не поменялось. Все тот же геморрой для красноглазых
стабильная версия нестабильна (
